definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on

sentences.english: I'm thinking in terms of a visit to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我正切磋去巴黎渴念景仰。

sentences.english: Little mouse climbing wall, the wall of praise is admired the world's greatest.
sentences.chinese: 小老鼠爬到牆邊十分景仰的讚美牆是世界上最偉大的。

sentences.english: In the meanwhile, love and suffer, hope and contemplate.
sentences.chinese: 在死以前，爲愛而忍痛，爲希望而景仰吧。

sentences.english: Savviness is what journalists admire in others.
sentences.chinese: 理智是記者景仰別人的原因。

sentences.english: Why do so few students admire their own parents?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼如此少的孩子景仰父母？

sentences.english: I've always looked upon your church with admiration.
sentences.chinese: 我對貴教一向是萬分景仰的。

sentences.english: If you're in the position to make choices, go to work for organizations and people you admire.
sentences.chinese: 如果你可以選擇的話，爲你景仰的公司和個人工作。

sentences.english: My veneration for your honor will go on and on just like the surging river.
sentences.chinese: 在下對前輩的景仰有如滔滔江水，綿綿不絕。

sentences.english: Who is the person you most looke up to?
Their heroic deeds, admired by the Poples, are spread through the ages.
sentences.chinese: 他們的英雄事蹟，受萬衆景仰，被千古流傳。

sentences.english: Toscanini commanded the admiration of music lovers all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 卡尼尼博得了世界各地音樂愛好者的景仰。

sentences.english: She guided the tourists throughout the castle.
sentences.chinese: 她指點旅遊者渴念景仰了這座城堡。

definition: to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to admire/to hold in high esteem
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
